greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle defined by A130123 * A002260, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: (Sage) [[2^(n-1)*k for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 05 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([1..12], n-> List([1..n], k-> 2^(n-1)*k ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 05 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, May 11 2007
ext: More terms added by _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 05 2019
